question: Hey baby, how was school? Oh, that good for nothin dog of yours, got his little ass in the living room and acted a damn fool, that's what happened. Now baby, you can't come in here, there's broken glass all over the floor, and you gonna cut yourself. This is a old friend of mommy's I ain't seen in a long time.
answer: Hello sweety, I'm * *, what's your name?

question: Her name is Nikki.
answer: Nikki. What a pretty name for such a pretty little girl. How old are you Nikki?

question: Nikki, * * aked you a question.
answer: Four years old, aye. You know I once had a little girl. She'd be five right now. Maybe you two could of played with each other.

question: Now baby, me an * * have some grown-up talk to talk about, so you go in your room now and leave us alone till I tell you to come out. Nikkia - in your room - now. Want some coffee?
answer: Yeah, sure.

question: Cream and sugar?
answer: Both, please. This Pasadena homemaker's name is Jeanne Bell. Her husband is Dr. Lawrence Bell. But back when we were acquainted, five years ago, her name was VERNITA GREEN. Her code name, was "COBRA"..... Mine was BLACK MAMBA. Were you expecting me?

question: Both, please. This Pasadena homemaker's name is Jeanne Bell. Her husband is Dr. Lawrence Bell. But back when we were acquainted, five years ago, her name was VERNITA GREEN. Her code name, was "COBRA"..... Mine was BLACK MAMBA. Were you expecting me?
answer: Yes and no. Bill got in touch with me right after you woke up, and then again a little later after your episode in Japan. So I suppose it's a little late for a apology, huh?

question: You suppose correctly.
answer: Even if I was sincere?

question: Oh. I'm quite positive you're sorry, now.
answer: Look bitch, I need to know if you're gonna start anymore shit around my baby girl!

question: You can relax for now. I'm not going to murder you in front of your daughter.
answer: That's being more rational than Bill led me to believe you were capable of.

question: Well that's a demonstration of Bill's complete ignorance when it comes to the subject of me, and what I'm thinking, and what I might do. It's mercy, compassion, and forgiveness I lack, not rationality. I'll wait for now, but I won't wait for long. I'll allow you to choose a time and place for us to meet again, preferably as far away from Nikki as possible. I could have just HIT you, I didn't, I demand respect for that. Since this is not a HIT, consider it a DUEL. And as two former Deadly Vipers, we will observe Viper rules of honor. One on one - no help - no bushwhackin - no treacherous weapons - on weapon of choice - our skill and our bodies.

- I'm not through telling you. Failure to keep our date, or duplicity of any kind, will result in me putting a xoxo hollow point bullet into the back of your skull from a window of a building across the street from Nikki's elementary school. Now, feel free to respond.
answer: Look...I know I fucked you over. I fucked you over bad. I wish to God I hadn't, but I did. If I could go back in a machine I would, but I can't. All I can tell you is I'm a different person now.

question: I don't care.
answer: Be that as it may, I know I do not deserve mercy or forgiveness. However, I beseech you for both on behalf of my daughter.

question: -- Bitch, you can stop right there. Just because I have no wish to murder you before the eyes of your daughter, does not mean parading her around in front of me is going to inspire sympathy. You and I have unfinished business.
answer: You have every right to wanna get even --

question: -- But that's where you're wrong, Vernita. I don't want to get even. To get even, even Steven. I would have to kill you, go into Nikki's room, kill her, then wait for your old man, Dr. Bell, to come home and kill him. That would make us even. No, my unborn daughter will just hafta be satisfied with your death at her mother's hands.
answer: When do we do this?

question: It all depends... When do you want to die? Tomorrow? The day after tomorrow? That's about as long as I'll wait.
answer: How bout tonight, bitch?

question: Spendid. Where?
answer: There's a baseball diamond where our little league has its games, about a mile from here. We meet there around two-thirty in the morning, dressed all in black, your hair in a black stocking, and we have us a knife fight, we won't be

question: Bill said you were one of the best ladies he'd ever seen with an edged weapon.
answer: Fuck you, bitch, I know he didn't qualify it, so you can just kiss my motherfuckin ass, Black Mamba. Black Mamba, I shoulda been motherfuckin Black Mamba.

question: Weapon of choice? And if you want to stick with your butcher knife, I'm cool with that.
answer: Very funny. Sorry, bout the bushwhack. Please don't...

question: Hey Warren, she just blinked.
answer: He said she can't blink.

question: I know what he said, I'm tellin ya
answer: Just wait, when I get through with this little dumbbell, she gonna stand up and recite the Gettysburg Ad-dress. Hey, Gerald.

question: Yeah?
answer: This shit ain't no peep show. Go out in the hall and I'll let ya know when it's your turn.

question: Awww c'mon, I gotta leave the room?
answer: I can't get no errection wit you lookin at me, so go on.

question: Where's Bill?
answer: Who?

question: Bill! Where is Bill!
answer: I dunno no Bill.

question: I saw him here myself..... SLAM! ....Now do you tell me where he is, or do I beat your fuckin brains in?
answer: Please please stop, don't hit me again!

question: Where is Bill? Where did you get this from?
answer: That's mine.

question: English?
answer: Almost -- American.

question: Ahhhh,...America, welcome... Welcome... My English -- Very good.
answer: Domo.

question: Oh, "Domo", Very good -- very good, you speak Japanese?
answer: Nooo, just a few words I learned since yesterday. - May I sit at the bar?

question: Sure sure sure - sit. What other words did you learn - excuse me -- -- What other Japanese you learn?
answer: Oh...let's see..."Arigato."

question: "Arigato"...Very good.
"Ah-So!" You know what "Ah-So" means
answer: "I See."

question: I see - Very good.
answer: I already said "Domo", right?

question: Yes.
answer: "Kon-netie-wa."

question: ..."Kon-nichi-wa"...repeat please.
answer: "Kon-nichi-wa?"

question: Most impressive...you say Japanese words, like you Japanese.
answer: Now you're making fun of me.

question: No no no - serious business. Pronunciation - very good. You say "Arigato" ...like we say "Arigato."
answer: Well, thank you - I mean...arigato.

question: You should learn Japanese - very easy.
answer: No kidding, I heard it's kinda hard.

question: What!
answer: I always heard it was difficult.

question: Yes yes yes - most difficult. But you have Japanese tongue.
answer: Maybe I was Japanese in another life.

question: Most definitely, most definitely Japanese in another life.
answer: How did you know tuna's my favorite?

question: What!
answer: Tuna's my favorite.

question: Ah, thank you very much.
answer: I beg your pardon?

question: - Drink -
answer: Oh yes, a bottle of warm sake.

question: Ahhh sake, Very good. First time in Japan?
answer: A-huh.

question: What!
answer: Yes, this is my first time.

question: What brings you to Okinawa?
answer: I came to see a man.

question: Aaahh, you have friend live in Okinawa?
answer: Not quite.

question: Not friend?
answer: I've never met him.

question: Who is he, may I ask?
answer: Hattori Hanzo.

question: What do you want with Hattori Hanzo?
answer: I need Japanese steel.

question: Why do you need Japanese steel?
answer: I have vermin to kill.

question: You must have big rats you need Hattori Hanzo steel.
answer: Huge. May I?

question: Huge. May I?
answer: Yes you may..... ...try the second one down in the sixth row on your left. Funny, you like samurai swords... ...I like baseball. I wanted to show you these.... However someone as you, who knows so much must surely know, I no longer make instruments of death. I keep these here for their ascetic and sentimental value. Yet proud tho I am of my life's work... I am retired.

question: Then give me one of these.
answer: These are not for sale.

question: I didn't say, sell me. I said, give me.
answer: And why should I be obliged to assist you in the extermination of your vermin?

question: Because my vermin, is a former student of yours. And considering the student, I'd say you had a rather large obligation.
answer: ...You can sleep there... ...it will take me a week to make the sword... ...I suggest you spend it practicing. I've done this, because philosophically I'm sympathetic to your aim. Revenge is never a straight line. It's a forest. And like a forest it's easy to lose your way...to get lost... to forget where you came in. To serve as a compass, a combat philosophy must be adopted that can be found in the secret doctrine of the Yagu Ninja. And now my yellow haired warrior, repeat after me; "When engaged in combat, the vanquishing of thine enemy can be the warrior's only concern... ...This is the first and cardinal rule of combat... ...Suppress all human emotion and compassion... ...Kill whoever stands in thy way, even if that be Lord God, or Buddha himself... This truth lies at the heart of the art of combat. Once it is mastered... Thou shall fear no one... Though the devil himself may bar thy way...

question: Those of you lucky enough to still have your lives. Take them with you. But leave the limbs you've lost. They belong to me now. Any more subordinates for me to kill, O-Ren?
answer: One last one.

question: You're Mr. Barrel, right?
answer: And you're Black Mamba.

question: Our reputations precede us.
answer: Apparently.

question: Tell me Mr. Barrel, why don't you wear your Kato mask? Are you and iconoclast?
answer: I don't like that rubber band. It fucks up my hair.

question: You shouldn't work for her.
answer: Too late.

question: It's not too late to quit.
answer: Do you have choices?

question: No.
answer: I know exactly how you feel.

question: This has nothing to do with You and I, and everything to do with me taking satisfaction from that bitch behind you. And there's absolutely positively no way I'M going to leave here without taking that satisfaction. So Mr. Barrel, you have to stand aside. And that means you must quit, right now.
answer: I can't.

question: Yes you can.
answer: No I can't.

question: Don't say "Can't", there are no "Cant's." Yes - You - Can.....
answer: What are you waiting for? Are you on a date? Attack her you fool!

question: Oh my God... ...She just called you a fool. She just called you a fool in front of me. Not only am I your opponent. I'm a female fellow countryman. And you're going to risk your life - to say nothing of harming me - for a woman who refers to you as a fool?
answer: is furious, and slaps Mr. Barrel on the shoulder. Attack, Goddamn you!

question: I'll owe ya one.
answer: The things I do for a pretty face. I quit. About that one you owe me.

question: Yes?
answer: I'm gonna collect someday, you know?

question: I'll be disappointed if you don't.
answer: Tough luck bout that arm Sofe.

question: Very funny. Your instrument is quite impressive.
answer: Domo.

question: Where was it made?
answer: Okinawa.

question: Whom in Okinawa made you this steel?
answer: This is Hattori Hanzo steel.

question: YOU LIE!! Swords however never get tired. I hope you've saved your energy. If you haven't, you might not last five minutes.
answer: No.

question: Oh, you really should. It's quite beautiful. Allow me. As last looks go, you could do worse. when her Sword is fully unsheathed, the Japanese combat artist holds both arms straight out at her sides, Sword in one hand - Wood sheath in the other, like a bird.... Silly Caucasian girl likes to play with samurai swords. Bill might of humored you, but you will find neither humor nor mercy at my blade. Now unless you intend to commit sepeku among the koi, stand up and fight. You may not be able to fight like a samurai, but you can at least die like a samurai.
answer: Attack me. With everything you have.

question: I apologize for ridiculing you earlier.
answer: Accepted. Ready?

question: Yes. That really was a Hattori Hanzo sword... I always dreamed of owning one... Did he make it for you?
answer: Yes.

question: ...He must of liked you.
answer: I've kept you alive for one reason. Information. Being O-Ren's lawyer, I take it you're familiar with Bill?

question: I've kept you alive for one reason. Information. Being O-Ren's lawyer, I take it you're familiar with Bill?
answer: Yes.

question: In fact, I'd guesstimate, you worked for Bill before O-Ren, and that's how it is you came to work for O-Ren. Am I correct?
answer: Yes.

question: I thought so. Give me the arm you have left.
answer: Why?

question: I want information. Now gimme your arm. The cocktail racing through your bloodstream at this moment is Bill's own recipe. He calls it "The Undisputed Truth." Okay, first things first. Where was the other Yubari sister? Yuki?
answer: Yuki's sick. She went home early.

question: Do tell? What's wrong with her?
answer: She has a cold.

question: Awwww poor baby. What do you think she'll do when she finds out what happened?
answer: She'll wail with grief. She'll drink excessively. She'll start trouble.

question: When she stops shedding tears, she'll start shedding blood.
answer: Best guess, what will she do?

question: I don't hafta guess, she'll come after you.
answer: Will she ever give up?

question: She won't have to. When she finds
answer: Is she more skilled than I?

question: Skilled won't be the word.
answer: Don't be coy with me, bitch. What would be the word?

question: Crazy.
answer: Okay, now I want all the information on the Deadly Vipers,... What they've been doing and where I can find them.

question: Please forgive my betrayal -- But, still -- Guessing won't be necessary. She informed me.
answer: I'm allowing you to keep your wicked life for one reason and one reason only. So you can tell him, in person, everything that happened here tonight. I want him to witness the extent of my mercy..., by witnessing your deformed body. I want you to tell him, all the information you just told me. I want him to know what I know. I want him to know I want him to know. And I want them all to know, they'll all soon be as dead as O

question: Two down, and three to go.
answer: Conigute wa!

question: Conigute wa. Yuki?
answer: Bingo!

question: Can I help you?
answer: You can kill yourself. Taking a trip?

question: I was.
answer: You still are. One way.

question: I know you feel you must avenge your sister. But I beg you...walk away.
answer: You call that begging? You can beg better than that. Can I see your face? I've heard your beauty is exquisite. I would like to see for myself.

question: Sure.
answer: Ohhhh,...look how pretty your face is. Oooohhh,... I want to touch it.

question: Domo.
answer: Your face is so pretty, I just want to put both of my palms against your cheeks and give you little tiny kisses. How do I look?

question: Very pretty.
answer: You're just saying that 'cause I told you how pretty you are.

question: Yuki, you're gorgeous.
answer: Really? Is that how you'd describe me to somebody if I wasn't here? Yuki's gorgeous?

question: You bet. Don't make me kill you.
answer: Okay. You think you're safe! I say; Ha!

question: Stay in your house and stay down on the floor!
answer: Time for the rabbit to come out of her hole!

question: Gotcha!
answer: You fucking bitch! You shot me in my breast! They're not fully developed yet, you fucking asshole! Now I'm always gonna have a dimple! Piss me off!

question: Yuki, in about two minutes there's going to be an army of police here. So if you're gonna kill me, now's the time.
answer: That fucking does it!

question: Goddamn, what a wildcat.
answer: Hello.

question: Hello, I'm calling Nurse Owens --
answer: Who is this.

question: You don't know me, but --
answer: -- And I don't want to neither. Now

question: -- I've been shot five times --
answer: -- Stop, I don't wanna hear no more. I got problems of my own.

question: I'm dying.
answer: Then bitch, you better call yourself a ambulance, cause I don't do this shit no more.

question: I can't call an ambulance.
answer: -- No, you can call a ambulance, you just don't want to. But if your ass is really dying, you ain't got no motherfuckin choice.

question: I do have a choice, and I'm choosing to call you. If you refuse to help me, I'll die. And that will be your choice.
answer: Bitch, I don't even know you!

question: What do you need to know? I'm from Earth, I'm a woman, I'm dying, and only you can help me.
answer: Okay, where you at?

question: I'm in Hawthorne. I'm hiding in a kids treehouse. It's a street called, "Dimmick". 1-7-3-6 Dimmick Avenue. There's a bunch of police cars and firetrucks, about two blocks away.
answer: Whatcha do, crawl two blocks?

question: If you can't walk, you better crawl.
answer: You got you some money dontcha, or am I doin this out of the goodness of my heart?

question: You come and get me, today's pay day.
answer: You ain't too far away. You gonna bleed to death I get there in a half a hour?

question: Probably.
answer: Okay, I'll be there in fifteen minutes.

question: Is that Pacific Standard Time, or C.P.T.?
answer: Just you better be there when I get there, and you better be shot five times, and your bony ass better be on your last motherfuckin legs.

question: How do you know I have a bony ass?
answer: You sound like you have a bony ass.

question: Glad you made it.
answer: There's cops all over here, I had to be cool. They tend to notice things like Negroes sneaking around people's backyards.

question: What's that?
answer: This shit's gonna hurt, and I ain't got no anesthetic.

question: That fuckin smarts.
answer: Yeah, bullets are bad news. In the future, you should avoid them if you can.

question: I'll keep that in mind. So, do I have a future?
answer: You'll live to kill again.

question: That, no one ever calls me. Not anymore?
answer: I'll take that.

question: You'll have to. I give you my word of honor, I will start nothing.
answer: Miss O'Boyle required a two-hundred dollar membership fee.

question: That's rather pricey.
answer: You wanna play for free, go to Vegas. You start now you'll be there by sundown.

question: I think I'll stay here. I'm thirsty.
answer: That way.

question: Beer. Twenty dollars for a beer? What am I going to do, I'm thirsty. Pour the beer. I don't get that? Cheers. I came to play. I'm not implying anything.
answer: That did it fuckhead, you're out the door --

question: You looked me over when I stood in your doorway. I'm looking you over as I step up to your table. If I don't know, I don't throw. More or less. Oh, I'm sorry, I thought you were trying to take my money, and I was trying to take yours. If you're game, take my bet sportsman. Shoot it all. Shoot it all. Shoot it all. Play a game of luck long enough you're bound to meet some lucky people. And I'm not interested. I didn't come here to make friends. I came here to shoot a little crap. But then your boy over there hits me up for a two hundred dollar privilege to play fee -- -- You and nobody else. You sell at the bar a half can of warm piss, at twenty bucks a shot. How much did the six-pack cost you? 5.60, 5.65? You're greedy O'Boyle. You're just too Goddamn greedy. You know what I like to do when I meet greedy people? Take every fuckin thing they got. Leave em with nothing. I wanna burn you down. When I'm through with you, you won't have a pot to piss, or a window to throw it out of. You'll thumb a ride out of L.A. wearing a barrel. To be replaced by a different fate. The embarrassing truth that you run a gutless game. I won't forget it. I'm sure these gentlemen won't forget it. I'm sure they'll tell people who won't forget it. And we won't come back. If we don't come back, you won't get our money. Couple of weeks, you won't have a game. Oooohhh, that's.... Yes I would.....Shoot it all.....Against myself. Did I stutter, I'm changing my bet. I'm betting I don't make it.
answer: You can't do that.

question: Great day in the morning. Brother Bill livin up to his familia obligation.
answer: How ya doin' Budd?

question: Oh, you know my life, Bill, just a mad rush of wild parties and wealthy women. Is that that tall blonde one-eyed Viking bitch in the passenger seat?
answer: It's Elle. Want to say hello?

question: Never said "bye," can't seem to think of a reason to say, "hi." What'd ya wanna talk about?
answer: Are you not going to invite me in?

question: No.
answer: May I ask why not?

question: It stinks in there, that's why. Now what's so important it requires a reunion? You tryin to tell me she cut her way through eighty-eight bodyguards 'fore she got to O-Ren?
answer: No. There wasn't really eighty eight of them, they just called themselves The Crazy 88.

question: Why.
answer: I dunno, I guess they thought it sounded cool. Anyhow, she had about 26 or 27 around her when attacked. They all fell under her Hanzo sword.

question: She got 'er a Hattori Hanzo sword?
answer: She has a Hanzo Jingi sword.

question: He made her one? Didn't he swear a blood oath never to make another sword?
answer: It would appear he's broken it.

question: Them Japs know how to carry a grudge don't they? Or is it just you tend to bring that out in people?
answer: I know this is a ridiculous question before I ask, but you by any chance haven't kept up with your swordplay?

question: Hell, I pawned that years ago.
answer: You pawned a Hattori Hanzo sword?

question: Yep.
answer: It was priceless.

question: Not in El Paso it ain't. In El Pso I got me 250 Dollars for it.
answer: Since it was a gift from me, why didn't you offer me the chance to buy it back?

question: Because that would've required me to acknowledge your existence. Drunken bum though I may be, I don't need booze that bad. But who the hell gives a crap anyway. That bitch ain't gittin no Bushido points for killin a white trash piece of shit like me with a samurai sword. I'm a bouncer in a titty bar, Bill. If she wants to fight me, all she gotta do is come down to the Club, start some shit, and we'll be in a a fight.
answer: -- Budd, you need to listen to me. I know we haven't spoken for quite some time, and the last time we spoke wasn't the most pleasant. But you need to get over being mad at me, and start becoming afraid of Bea. Because she is coming, and she's coming to kill you. And unless you accept my assistance, I have no doubt she will succeed. Can't we forget the past, and look at the happy side of all this?

question: And what would that happy side be?
answer: She's brought "the boys" back together.

question: Bet your sweet ass that don't sting like a bitch. You done got a double dose of rock salt, right in the ole tit. Now not havin tits as fine or as big as yours, I can't even imagine how bad that shit stings... ...But I don't wont to neather. Now I know when it comes to a rock salt burn, you're feelin pretty much like a expert bout now. But truth be told, you ain't felt all rock salt's got to offer till you took a double dose in your backside. That gentled ya down, didn't it? Yep...ain't nobody a badass with two barrels of rock salt dug deep in their backyard.
answer: Bill?

question: Wrong brother, you hateful bitch.
answer: ....Budd?

question: Bingo.
answer: And what do I owe this dubious pleasure?

question: I just caught me the cowgirl, ain't never been caught.
answer: Do you mean what I think you mean?

question: If you think I mean I got 'er, you thought right.
answer: Did you kill her?

question: Not yet I ain't. But I can sure do it easy enough. She's so gentle right now, I could preform her coup de grace with a rock.
answer: What are you waiting for, run outta liquid courage.

question: No. It's just...I ain't killed nobody in a long Goddamn time. And just 'tween you, me, and Jesus Christ, kinda made me a promise I wasn't gonna. Be that however it is. Back when I did kill people...I got paid for it. Just don't seem right...turn amateur this time of life. Anywho, guess what I'm holdin in my hand right now. A brand spankin new Hattori Hanzo sword. And I'm here to tell ya Elle, that's what I call sharp.
answer: How much?

question: Oh, that's hard to say. Seein it's priceless and all.
answer: I'll give you a hundred thousand dollars for it.

question: I'm sure you would. But I'll take, one million.
answer: Jeez Budd, who'd ever guess you were such a capitalist. I thought drunks like yourself were beyond such monetary concerns?

question: Well Elle, a million dollars buys a whole lotta Jack.
answer: Why then are you selling it to a hateful bitch like me, when you know Bill would pay more?

question: If I'm gonna drink myself to death, ...it won't be on Bill's dollar. It's gonna be on yours.
answer: What's the terms?

question: You buy a ticket to Texas, and I'll see you here tomorrow mornin. You give me a million in foldin cash, I'll give you the greatest sword ever made by a man. How's that sound?
answer: Sounds like we got a deal. One

question: What?
answer: You kill her tonight. And one more thing.

question: You said one condition.
answer: It's a caveat to the same condition.

question: What?
answer: She must suffer to her last breath.

question: That Elle darlin, I can pretty damwell guarantee.
answer: Then I'll see you in the morning millionaire.

question: Once upon a time in China, some believe around the year, one-double knot-three.
answer: What praytell, is a ten-point palm - exploding heart technique?

question: Quite simply, the deadliest blow in all of the martial arts. He hits you with his fingertips, at ten different pressure points on your body. And then, he lets you walk away. But once you've taken five steps, your heart explodes inside your body, and you fall to the floor dead.
answer: Did he teach you that?

question: No. He teaches no one the ten-point palm - exploding heart technique. But he is Nietzsche's psalm personified. If Pai Mei doesn't kill you, he will make you stronger. Now one of the things I always liked about you, Kiddo, is you appear wise beyond your years. Then allow me to impart, a word to the wise. Whatever - WHAT - EVER - Pai Mei says, Obey. If you flash him - even for an instant - a defiant eye, he'll pluck it out. And if you throw any American sass his way, he will snap your back and your neck like they were twigs, and that will be the story of you. He'll accept you as his student.
answer: Caught him in a good mood, aye?

question: More like a sadistic one. Just seeing those steps again makes me ache. You're gonna have plenty of fun carrying buckets of water up and down that fucker.
answer: Why did he accept me?

question: Because he's a very very very old man. And like all rotten bastards, when they get old, they become lonely. Not that that has any effect on their disposition. But they do learn the value of company.
answer: When will I see you again?

question: That's the title of my favorite soul song of the Seventies.
answer: What?

question: Nothing. When he tells me you're done.
answer: When do you think that might be?

question: That my dearest, all depends on you. Now remember, no backtalk, no sarcasm. Least not for the first year. You're going to have to let him warm up for you. He hates Caucasians, despises Americans, and has nothing but contempt for women, so in your case, that may take a little while. Adios.
answer: Hello! More stairs, Jesus Christ. No please don't! Wow! I'd like a glass of water.

question: Want some breakfast?
answer: ...So that's called a Texas funeral?

question: Yep.
answer: I got to give it to ya Budd, that's a pretty fucked up way to die. What's the name on the grave she's buried under?

question: Paula Schultz.
answer: Can I look at the sword?

question: That's my money in that black case, isn't it?
answer: Sure is.

question: Well then, it's your sword now.
answer: So this, is a Hattori Hanzo sword.

question: That's a Hanzo sword alright.
answer: Bill tells me you once had one of your own.

question: Once.
answer: How does this one compare to that one?

question: If you're gonna compare a Hanzo sword, you compare it to every So, which "R" you filled with?
answer: What?

question: They say the number one killer of old people is retirement. People got'em a job to do, they tend to live a little longer so they can do it. I've always figured warriors and their enemies share the same relationship. So now you ain't gonna hafta face your enemy on the battlefield no more, which "R" are you filled with, Relief or Regret?
answer: A little bit of both.

question: Bullshit. I'm sure you do feel a little bit of both. But I know damn well you feel one more than you feel the other. The question was which one?
answer: Regret.

question: Yeah you gotta hand it to the ol' girl. I never saw nobody buffalo Bill the way she buffaloed Bill. Bill useta think she was so damn smart. I tried to tell him... Bill, she's just smart for a blonde.
answer: Want your money?

question: Great day in the morning.
answer: Oh, I'm sorry Budd, that was rude of me wasn't it? Budd -- I'd like to introduce my friend, The Black Mamba. Black Mamba -- this is Budd. You know before I picked up that little fella, I looked him up on the internet. Now in these last agonizing minutes of life you have left, let me answer the question you asked earlier, more thoroughly. When it comes to that bitch, I gotta lotta "R's" in me. Revenge is one. Retribution is another. Rivalry is definitely one. But I got another Bill...Elle. I have some tragic news. Your brother's dead. I'm sorry baby. She put a Black Mamba in his camper. I got her, sweety. She's dead. Let me put it this way. If you ever start feeling sentimental, go to Austin, Texas. When you get here, walk into a florist and buy a bunch of flowers. Then you take those flowers to Huntington cemetery on Fuller and Guadalupe, look for the headstone marked "Paula Schultz", then lay them on the grave. Because you will be standing at the final resting place of BEATRIX KIDDO.

question: Bravo, Bea. I actually thought that alacky had got the best of you.
answer: You thought wrong.

question: What's that?
answer: Budd's Hanzo sword.

question: He said he pawned it.
answer: Guess that makes him a liar, don't it? Elle?

question: Bea.
answer: I was wondering, just 'tween us girls, what did you say to Pai Mei for him to snatch out your eye?

question: I called him a bastard.
answer: Oooh, not so good.

question: Were I to do it over again, I'd bite my tongue.
answer: One more question?

question: Shoot.
answer: Where's Bill?

question: Villa Quatro.
answer: Gulf of Mexico? You wouldn't lie to me now?

question: Why lie?
answer: I saw what you did to that little Mamba in there. Want to try that on somebody your own size?

question: I intend to.
answer: Oh Elle, I should warn you before we get started. Hattori Hanzo swords are extremely sharp. They can take a little getting used to. Careful not to cut your own arm off.

question: I don't rattle, bitch!
answer: You're gonna bleed though, you're gonna bleed a lot.

question: Mr. Bill, you wanted me to tell you to leave now.
answer: Yes, I got to go and meet the Duchess. Do you like it?

question: Oh yes Mr. Bill, it's very pretty.
answer: Why don't you put it on the dinner table, so we can enjoy it tonight.

question: Good idea, she'll love it.
answer: Oh and Josephina, take the remaining flowers and spread them around the house, if you would.

question: Yes, Mr. Bill.
answer: You know I just had a great idea. Take the roses, and spread the petals on the bed I just got for her. That'd be a nice thing to come home to, wouldn't it, a bed of roses.

question: Oh, she'll love that Mr. Bill.
answer: You wouldn't mind doing that for me, would you Josephina?

question: Hola.
answer: Hello Bill.

question: Kiddo, is that really you?
answer: Oh, it's me all right.

question: I hear you were driving a truck?
answer: My pussy wagon died on me. Who's your little friend?

question: Oh, you mean the little tow head next to me, who looks extraordinarily like you?
answer: Yeah, that one.

question: Her name is B.B.
answer: B.B.?

question: Yes. Do you approve?
answer: Yes. Can she hear us?

question: Not now, she's in dream land.
answer: How old is she?

question: What do you mean by that?
answer: How many years has she been alive?

question: Don't ask how old she is, ask, if she's five.
answer: Is she five?

question: Aren't mothers like God, aren't you supposed to automatically know?
answer: I did and I do. I want to meet her.

question: Have dinner with us at my hacienda tonight. She's expecting you.
answer: What do you mean?

question: I knew you were on your way, so I told B.B. Her mommy was coming to see her.
answer: What have you told her about me?

question: That you were sick, that you were asleep, but one day you'd wake up and come back to her. And she asked me, "If Mommy's been asleep since I was born, how will she know what I look like?" To which I replied, "Because Mommy's been dreaming of you." And she said, "Then I'm gonna start dreaming of her." So I gave her a
answer: -- which one?

question: The one I took of you in Paris, sitting on the steps with the baguette in your hand. Since she was one and a half years old, she's slept with that picture of you next to her bed.
answer: You know, prettier photos of me do exist.

question: And she's seen them. But the one she wants looking after her while she sleeps is the one of you holding bread. We normally have dinner around seven, is that convenient?
answer: Yes. When do we cross swords?

question: Well, it just so happens, my hacienda comes with its very own private beach. And my private beach, just so happens to look particularly beautiful bathed in moonlight. And there just so happens to be a full moon out tonight. So, swordfighter, if you
answer: Do me a courtesy?

question: Anything.
answer: Slow down as we pass...I want another look at her.

question: Wear something nice tonight?
answer: I have a dress all picked out.

question: Will I like it?
answer: You said I looked beautiful last time you saw me in it.

question: I'll dress up too.
answer: You fucking maricone!

question: Now you just wait one second there little missy. Unless I'm confused, we are trying to kill each other aren't we? Now I wasn't planning on taking a shot at you in front of the squirt, but, she is asleep. And if you're gonna forget everything I ever taught you, and gawk like you ain't got good sense, I'm gonna take a shot, am I not?
answer: Did she wake up?

question: Hello....
answer: Hattori!

question: Beatrix, what's wrong?
answer: She's alive! My baby girl's alive!

question: Half of Bill's strength, lies in his talent for the unexpected. If you intend to vanquish this man, and claim your daughter, you must not only expect the unexpected. You must do the unexpected.
answer: Hello Manny. Hello Josephina.

question: When I showed you Mommy's picture, tell Mommy what you said. C'mon shy girl, you know what you said, tell Mommy, it'll make her fell good. That's the truth. That's what she said.
answer: Oh, Mommy spilled something on her dress. No. Kool-Aid. Do you like Kool-Aid?

question: Do you not like it, or do you not know what it is?
answer: Well, it's a very tasty beverage that I used to drink, when I was a little girl. It comes in a lot of different flavors and colors, and it's really good. Maybe we should fix some sometime. Want to do that?

question: Speaking of fixing and drinking and eating, I think it's dinner time don't you? When you were doin all that fancy shootin, you didn't happen to shoot a nice Mexican woman about forty five years old, did ya?
answer: No.

question: Did she go to sleep easy?
answer: It took her a little bit. She was excited. She's quite the little chatterbox.

question: Well, if she doesn't like you, you got to kill her to say hello. But if she likes you, you can't shut her up. She's a chip off the ole blonde in that regards. Red wine? C'mon, Bea, you're a whole lot more fun with a couple glasses of wine in ya. We're going to go out there and have at it, aren't we? Well, I've already had a glass. So unless you want to win by an unfair advantage, you should have a glass of wine. So we're both on the same footing wine wise. You know, there's an old man down here, his name is Esteban Viharo. He was a pimp. I knew him when I was a child. He was a friend of my mother's. I told him about you. When I showed him your picture he smiles and said; "Yesss, I see the attraction." He told me a story about taking me to the movies when I was five. It was a movie which had Lana Turner in it. And whenever she would appear on screen, he said I would stick my thumb in my mouth and suck it, to an obscure amount. And he knew right then, this boy will be a fool for blondes.
answer: Who would of ever thought you'd be such a good father?

question: Well not you, that's for damn sure.
answer: Must we have to endure your little zingers?

question: No we mustn't. But if you're going to say sentences like that, in the future, I will resist the temptation.
answer: Baby, you don't have a future.

question: I sent you to L.A. and you never came back. I thought you'd been killed. Do you know how cruel it is to make someone think someone they love is dead? I mourned you. Then in the third month of my mourning, I track you down. I wasn't trying to track you down, I was trying to track down - the fucking assholes - who I thought killed you. And when I find you, what to I find? Not only are you not dead, you're getting married - to some fuckin jerk - and you're pregnant? How do you expect me to react?
answer: Why do you think I hid?

question: Why did you leave in the first place? You have cold eyes towards me now. I understand their temperature, but they were warm the second to the last time I saw them, or was that just my imagination?
answer: No. You sent me to L.A. to kill that lady scoundrel, Lisa Wong.

question: You are you talking in Japanese?
answer: What the hell do you care what I talk in? Don't you know when to keep your mouth shut? I'm trying to tell you what you want to know, if you'll just shut up and listen and stop talking! Now may I continue?

question: You're right, I'm wrong, continue.
answer: The morning I left, I threw up. I don't feel like speaking in Japanese anymore - on the plane, I threw up. When I got to my hotel, I threw up. So naturally I started thinking, maybe I might be pregnant. So I bought one of those home pregnancy kits. Went back to my room and took the test. The little strip said blue. I was going to have a baby. I tried to call you, but you weren't there, so I just thought I'd call back later.

question: But you never did.
answer: - Would you shut up, I'm trying to tell you how I feel.

question: My apologies, please continue.
answer: So I just figured I'd call you back later. I was just so happy, I put on music and danced by myself in the hotel suite, holding my little blue strip. What I didn't know, was at some leg of my journey, I was spotted. With me in Los Angeles it didn't take Lisa Wong long to figure out someone put a hit out on her. So she sent an assassin of her own to Hello, can I help you? Oh, it's beautiful. But I'm kinda busy at this second, could you possibly come back later?

question: So I just figured I'd call you back later. I was just so happy, I put on music and danced by myself in the hotel suite, holding my little blue strip. What I didn't know, was at some leg of my journey, I was spotted. With me in Los Angeles it didn't take Lisa Wong long to figure out someone put a hit out on her. So she sent an assassin of her own to Hello, can I help you? Oh, it's beautiful. But I'm kinda busy at this second, could you possibly come back later?
answer: So you came here to kill Lisa Wong, huh? Well that's my sister, bitch. I'm Karen Wong, and I've come here to kill you.

question: Wait a second! Yes, I'm an assassin. Yes I did come here to kill your sister. But I'm not gonna do that now.
answer: Oh, I know you're not --

question: - listen to me! I just found out, right now - not two minutes before you blew a hole in the door, I'm pregnant. On that table is the home pregnancy kit. On the floor by the door is the strip that says I'm pregnant. I'm telling you the truth, I don't want to and I won't kill your sister. I just want to go home.
answer: What is this, bullshit story number twelve in the female assassin's handbook?

question: Any other time you'd be a hundred percent right. But this time you're a hundred percent wrong. I'm the deadliest woman in the world, but right now I'm scared shitless for my baby. Please, you hafta believe me. Look at the strip, it's on the floor.
answer: Sit down on that bed and put your hands behind your head.

question: Blue means pregnant.
answer: I'll read it myself, thank you. Okay, say I were to believe you, what then?

question: Just go home. I'll do the same.
answer: You fucked with the Wong sisters.

question: Facing Karen Wong, was the most frightening moment I have ever experienced. And that includes three years with that evil bastard Pai Mei. Before that strip turned blue, I was a woman, I was your woman. I was a killer, who killed for you. Before that strip turned blue, I would have jumped a motorcycle on to a speeding train ...for you. But once that strip turned blue, I could no longer do any of those things. Not anymore. Because now I was a mother. A mother who only had one thought on her mind. Please don't harm my baby. Can you understand that?
answer: Yes. But why tell me now, and not then?

question: You wouldn't have let me go. Specially once you found out I was pregnant. You would've tried to talk me out of it. It would have been a big scene. I just said fuck it.
answer: Fuck who?

question: Bill, you couldn't know I was pregnant, once you knew, you'd claim it, and I didn't want that.
answer: That's not your decision to make.

question: Yes, but it's the right decision. And I made it for my daughter. Everybody on this earth deserves to start with a clean slate. But with us - my daughter would be born into a world she shouldn't be. Robbing her of the one thing everybody deserves. She would be born with blood stains. I had to choose. I chose her. You know five years ago, if I had to make a list of impossible things that could never happen. You performing a coup de grace on me by bustin a cap in my crown, would be right at the top of the list. I'd've been wrong, wouldn't I?
answer: I'm sorry was that a question? Of impossible things that could never happen - yes in this instance you would have been wrong.

question: Well?
answer: Well what?

question: Explain yourself.
answer: I already have. When I told you the story of when I thought you were dead. Didn't you get how badly I felt?

question: You call that an explanation?
answer: Well if that's too cryptic let's get literal. There are consequences to breaking the heart of a murdering bastard. You experienced some of them.

question: You and I have unfinished business.
answer: Baby, you ain't kidding. You know how proud I am of you, don't you?

question: Yes.
answer: You know I was rooting for you, don't you?

question: I figured.
answer: You know on that beach out there I want you to be the victor? You also know you're going to have to defeat me. I can't just give it to you, even though I want to.

question: It won't be necessary for you to give me anything. I've surpassed you. I'll take it.
answer: Well, as they say in Missouri, show me. stares across the sand to the figure of the Bride, his student, facing him at sunrise with a weapon he taught her to use. This is where all who teach combat artistry may end up. Facing a Frankenstein monster of their own creation. He removes his Hanzo sword from its sheath with GREAT FLOURISH.

question: Attack me.
answer: That's my girl. He taught you the ten point palm exploding heart technique?

question: Of course he did.
answer: Why didn't you tell me?

question: I don't know...Because...I'm a...bad person.
answer: No. You're not a bad person. You're a terrific person. You're my favorite person. But every once in awhile...you can be a real cunt.
